Text: Participate in a casual match of Crystalline Conflict.

Score at least <If(GreaterThan(IntegerParameter(7),0))><Num>IntegerParameter(7)</Num><Else/><Num>IntegerParameter(8)</Num></If> points during a single <sheet(ContentType,IntegerParameter(2),0)> voyage.
Complete the quest “<sheet(Quest,IntegerParameter(1),0)>,” “<sheet(Quest,IntegerParameter(2),0)>,” or “<sheet(Quest,IntegerParameter(3),0)>” to unlock.

Win a game of <sheet(ContentType,IntegerParameter(2),0)> against <ennoun(ENpcResident,2,IntegerParameter(5),1,1)> in <ennoun(PlaceName,2,<sheet(TerritoryType,<sheet(Level,IntegerParameter(10),9)>,5)>,2,1)>.

<If(Equal(IntegerParameter(4),2))>Arrive at <ennoun(PlaceName,2,IntegerParameter(5),2,1)> or <ennoun(PlaceName,2,IntegerParameter(6),2,1)> to unlock.<Else/> Arrive at <If(GreaterThan(IntegerParameter(3),0))><ennoun(PlaceName,2,IntegerParameter(5),2,1)><Else/>???</If> to unlock.</If>
Victory or defeat will determine the quantity of rewards.
Rewards differ depending on the GATE. Rewards can be viewed from “See Rewards.”

Enter a treasure dungeon via a teleportation portal <Num>IntegerParameter(8)</Num> times.
※Treasure hunts abandoned midway through will not count toward the total.
Decipher a timeworn map and collect the treasure.
Complete a stage of the Masked Carnivale.

Complete <Num>IntegerParameter(8)</Num> critical <If(Equal(IntegerParameter(8),1))>engagement<Else/>engagements</If> <If(Equal(IntegerParameter(5),27))>on the Bozjan southern front<Else/>in Zadnor</If>.
※A fixed party is required to challenge floors 31 and beyond.
Rewards differ depending on total catch.
Begin <Lower><sheet(ContentType,IntegerParameter(2),0)></Lower> of any kind to unlock.
Complete the sidequest after “<sheet(Quest,IntegerParameter(1),0)>” to unlock.
Complete any society daily quest <Num>IntegerParameter(8)</Num> times.
Preview all dyeable gear with Dye 1 applied as a main color.
Preview all dyeable gear with Dye 2 applied as a secondary color.
Preview all dyeable gear with the same color applied as a secondary color.
Dye the selected item with the listed colors?
The following dyes will be used:
Collect MGF and exchange it for fabulous prizes!

Show Log
Names of qualified participants will be displayed here.
In survival stages, eliminated participants' names will be displayed.
Blunderville HUD placement and size can be adjusted while unlocked.
所持数の上限に達した場合、溢れた分の報酬は受け取れません。
You have been eliminated. You may either watch the next round via spectator mode or leave the show.
Chat Log Display When Applying Filters
Display the applicable term filter's number.
Hide the affected message in its entirety.
“<String>StringParameter(2)</String>” will be removed from the Term Filter List. Proceed?
(Message could not be displayed due to Term Filter <Num>IntegerParameter(1)</Num>.)

Adjust the resolution of UI assets.
Certain HUD widgets, windows, or action icons may change according to the settings selected.
※A reboot is required before changes are applied.

Standard
Render UI assets with HD or Full HD resolution settings.

High
Render UI assets with WQHD or 4K resolution settings.

Dynamically scale the resolution of individual render targets to reduce GPU workload and maintain a consistent frame rate.<If(Equal(PlayerParameter(78),2))>
※When NVIDIA DLSS is selected, graphics upscaling will be processed automatically.
※A target frame rate may still be selected.<Else/> </If><If(Equal(PlayerParameter(78),3))>
※A target frame rate may still be selected.<Else/> </If>

Adjust the quality of graphics scaling.
Improve performance by choosing a value between 50% and 100%.<If(Equal(PlayerParameter(78),2))>
※When NVIDIA DLSS is selected, graphics upscaling will be processed automatically.<Else/> </If>

Choose between NVIDIA or AMD graphics upscaling.

NVIDIA DLSS (Deep Learning Super Sampling)
Uses deep learning technologies to upscale lower resolutions to desired display settings.
※A GeForce RTX graphics card is required to enable this setting.

AMD FSR (FidelityFX Super Resolution)
Uses advanced upscaling technologies to upscale lower resolutions to desired display settings.

Adjust the detail of 3D objects based on their distance from the camera.
Maintain visual quality and improve performance through simplified rendering of distant character models and backgrounds.
Causes grass to move and sway in response to character movement.
Enable or disable the reflection of light and objects on water, floors, and other surfaces.
Adjust colors to blend the outline of objects and background images, smoothing out jagged edges for improved visual quality and performance.
When set to normal, uses simplified lighting to reduce graphical load and improve performance.
Adjust the display quality of grass that appears in the environment.
Uses parallax mapping to give the appearance of depth and definition in textured surfaces.
Uses tessellation to improve the appearance of water surfaces.
Enable or disable reflective glare on water surfaces.
Enable or disable the display of shadows. Settings can be adjusted by category for optimal performance.
Maintain visual quality and improve performance through simplified rendering of distant character shadows.
Maintain visual quality and improve performance through simplified rendering of distant background object shadows.
Adjust the resolution of textures used to render shadows.
Adjust the distance over which shadows will be rendered. Higher settings offer more realistic visuals, but impact performance.
Soften the edges of shadows to create a more natural aesthetic.

Adjust the resolution of textures used for characters and backgrounds.
※A reboot is required before changes are applied.

Adjust texture filtering settings.

Anisotropic
Uses sampling to ensure the proper appearance of textures on screen relative to the camera angle.

Trilinear
Smooths the transition between different texture resolutions while accounting for depth.

Bilinear
Calculates the average color for adjacent pixels to create more natural textures.
Adjust settings for anisotropic filtering. Higher values will result in smoother textures.
Adjust settings for movement physics. Settings can be adjusted by category for optimal performance.
Darkens the edges of the screen, drawing focus toward the center.
Creates a blur effect emanating from the center of a given point of origin on the screen such as an explosion.
Renders natural shadows for objects in close proximity to create more realistic visuals.
Adjust the intensity of light refracting or reflecting off surfaces.
Adjust the wavering distortion effect of scenery when viewed underwater.

Creates a blurred effect for objects and scenery beyond the camera's point of focus.
※Depth of Field is only applicable in cutscenes and when using group pose.
Adjust the level of detail used for distant objects and light reflections.

Select the main display. When multiple displays are connected, the primary display will be determined by your system settings.
※A reboot is required before changes are applied.

Select a desired screen mode.

Windowed
The application shares available main display space with all running applications.

Borderless Windowed
The application shares available main display space with all running appplications, but covers the entire screen.

Full Screen
The application has exclusive control of the main display.

Set the display resolution for the game.

Presets
Includes a list of pre-determined resolutions supported by your main display.
When Full Screen is selected, the main display's refresh rate will also be applied.

Custom
Freely adjust the width and height of the screen's resolution.
※Only available when Windowed is selected.

By default, HUD elements do not scale with the resolution of your screen, which may result in the UI appearing disproportionately small at higher resolutions. This setting allows you to select a suitable level of UI scaling relative to your desired display resolution.
※When a lower resolution is selected, scaling will be adjusted automatically.

While the size of individual HUD elements and windows can be freely adjusted, this setting determines their initial display size.
Selecting “Apply All” will reflect these changes in all UI elements, including those already displayed on the screen.
Adjust the brightness of the game's display so that colors appear correctly on-screen.
Adjust the brightness of your character's personal lighting.

Adjust the game's frame rate limit.

None
The frame rate is uncapped, increasing to the extent your system is capable.

Main Display Refresh Rate
Sets your main display's refresh rate as the frame rate limit.

60 fps
Sets the frame rate limit to 60 fps.

30 fps
Sets the frame rate limit to 30 fps.
Limits the game's frame rate when using another application while the game client is open but inactive.
Limits the game's frame rate when the game client is active, but your status is “Away from Keyboard.”

Set the display resolution for the game.

<If(Equal(PlayerParameter(75),4))>Full HD
Sets the display resolution to 1920x1080.
Recommended for superior performance.

WQHD
Sets the display resolution to 2560x1440.
Recommended for balanced performance.

4K
Sets the display resolution to 3840x2160.
Recommended for superior graphics.<Else/> </If><If(Equal(PlayerParameter(106),99))>Full HD
Sets the display resolution to 1920x1080.
Recommended for superior performance.

WQHD
Sets the display resolution to 2560x1440.
Recommended for balanced performance.

4K
Sets the display resolution to 3840x2160.
Recommended for superior graphics.<Else/> </If><If(Equal(PlayerParameter(78),99))><If(Equal(PlayerParameter(75),4))> <Else/>PS4 Standard
Sets the display to Full HD =1920x1080.

PS4 Pro
Sets the display to WQHD =2560x1440.</If><Else/> </If>

By default, HUD elements do not scale with the resolution of your screen, which may result in the UI appearing disproportionately small at higher resolutions. This setting allows you to select a suitable level of UI scaling relative to your desired display resolution.
※When a lower resolution is selected, scaling will be adjusted automatically.

By default, system UI elements do not scale with the resolution of your screen, which may result in these menus appearing disproportionately small at higher resolutions. Enabling this setting will ensure the system UI scales automatically with your screen's resolution.
Adjust the intensity of shadows cast when your character is illuminated.

Determine who has the right to eject characters from your estate hall or garden and bar characters from entering your property.
Click on the help button for more details.
Uncheck the box to disable blacklist referencing.
Remove the selected characters as secondary rightsholders.
Close window and discard all changes without saving?
Remove <String>StringParameter(1)</String> from your list of barred characters and allow them to enter your property?

All characters registered to this account will be barred from entering your property for 10 days. Are you sure you wish to add them to your list of barred characters?

Only the Main Rightsholder can remove characters from the list.
Apartments and private chambers cannot be renovated or relocated.
Can be used as a text command or saved as a macro.
Mute sound while bound by duty.
Toggle phantom actions and select an action to execute.
<If(Equal(PlayerParameter(78),3))>The highest possible graphical settings.<Else/>The highest possible graphical settings. Recommended for use with high-end PCs only.</If>
Settings optimized for <If(Equal(PlayerParameter(78),3))>high-end models allowing for superior graphical quality.<Else/>desktop PCs which meet the recommended specifications.</If>
Settings optimized for <If(Equal(PlayerParameter(78),3))>high-end models.<Else/>laptop PCs which meet the recommended specifications.</If>
<If(Equal(PlayerParameter(78),3))>Settings which ensure optimal performance<Else/>Settings which ensure optimal performance on desktop PCs</If> without compromising graphical quality.
<If(Equal(PlayerParameter(78),3))>Settings which ensure balanced performance.<Else/>Settings which ensure balanced performance on laptop PCs.</If>
You are not authorized to make interior style changes.
Interior style changes can only be made from your estate's garden.
The selected style is currently in use.
Unable to <switch(IntegerParameter(1),relocate or renovate,relocate,renovate)>. Your storage is full.

Gladiator, Marauder, Paladin, Warrior, Dark Knight
Pugilist, Lancer, Rogue, Archer, Arcanist, Thaumaturge, Monk, Dragoon, Ninja, Samurai, Bard, Machinist, Black Mage, Summoner, Red Mage
Unlocked upon completing the following exercise:
The Hall of the Novice offers training exercises for party combat.
To learn more, visit the Hall of the Novice in western La Noscea or speak with a Smith at an Adventurers' Guild after reaching Disciple of War or Magic level 15 and above.
Unlocked upon progressing deeper into the main scenario.
Complete all of the tactical exercises for a special reward!
Upon completing these exercises, you will receive brand-new gear for your chosen role as well as the brand-new ring, which increases EXP earned by 30% until level 30.

As your level rises, you will face greater combat challenges with all manner of dangerous enemy attacks. These exercises are designed to arm you with the knowledge you'll need to survive. Upon completing them, you will receive the neophyte's ring, which increases EXP earned by 30% until level 60.
This exercise may be undertaken by the following classes/jobs:
You must first unlock the Hall of the Novice in order to undertake these exercises.
